itemDescription: English grocer and draper and Liberal Party politician

wikipedia_page.main: Levi Lapper Morse (24 May 1853 – 10 September 1913) was an English grocer and draper and Liberal Party  politician.

response: *Levi Lapper Morse (Alderman to 1913, also member of parliament for Wilton)
*Levi Lapper Morse, grocer, draper and Liberal MP 1906–10.
* Levi Lapper Morse – English grocer and draper and Liberal Party politician

Morse was the son of Levi Lapper Morse, a prominent Swindon shopkeeper E. H. Goddard, The Wiltshire Archaeological and Natural History Magazine; Wiltshire Archaeological and Natural History Society, Item notes 1937-1939, p527 and the Liberal Member of Parliament for the Wilton or South Division of Wiltshire from 1906 to 1910. He was educated at the High School, Swindon. In 1910 he married Alma the daughter of Hawthorn Thornton of South Africa, a civil engineer.The Women's Who's Who, Shaw Publishing, 1934 p288 They appear to have two sons and a daughter.Who was Who, OUP 2007 Their second son, Stanley, was killed on active service with the Royal Air Force Volunteer Reserve in 1941.The Times, 18 August 1941 p1

Milne joined the GWR 1904 as a pupil engineer (training to be a locomotive engineer) in the locomotive department. He later moved to Paddington and gained operational and traffic experience. In 1912 Milne married Nora Rebekah Morse, daughter of Levi Lapper Morse.
